intro: Psychotria maranhana, commonly known as the Maranhão Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Brazil, specifically the states of Maranhão and Pará, where it grows in tropical rainforests. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It is also known for containing psychoactive alkaloids, similar to those found in other members of the Psychotria genus. Due to its habitat and chemical composition, it is of interest to both botanists and ethnobotrists.
